item.title: Frantic Search for Survivors in Guatemala After Mudslide Kills 69
item.description: Many people remain missing after a rain-sodden hillside collapsed Thursday night in a neighborhood on the outskirts of Guatemala City.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: China’s Ambitious Rail Projects Crash Into Harsh Realities in Latin America
item.description: New worries over China’s economy are also raising doubts about “railroad diplomacy” as parts of Latin America reel from their dependence on China.
item.dc:creator: SIMON ROMERO
item.media:credit: Marizilda Cruppe for The New York Times
item.media:description: Workers at a BRF food company plant in Lucas do Rio Verde, Brazil, that exports animal protein. Overall trade between China and Latin America surged to $285 billion in 2014 from $12 billion in 2000.

item.title: Frantic Search for Survivors in Guatemala After Mudslide Kills 56
item.description: Many people remain missing after a rain-sodden hillside collapsed Thursday night in a neighborhood on the outskirts of Guatemala City.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Brazil’s President Takes Steps on Austerity
item.description: Dilma Rousseff is scrambling to reassemble a fragmented coalition as her governing Workers Party reels from a bribery scandal.
item.dc:creator: SIMON ROMERO

item.title: Open Source: Brazilian Protester Shot With Rubber Bullet for Knocking Officer’s Cap Off
item.description: A sudden outburst of violence from a Brazilian police officer, caught on video, generated sympathy for a protest movement.
item.dc:creator: ROBERT MACKEY
item.media:description: A screen shot from the Facebook page of a protest movement in Recife, Brazil, showing the wound sustained by an activist who was shot with a rubber bullet on Thursday night.

item.title: World Briefing: Guatemala: Hundreds Are Missing After Mudslide
item.description: At least 26 people died and as many as 600 people were missing after a huge mudslide near Guatemala City.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: How Australia, Britain and Canada Have Responded to Gun Violence
item.description: In all three countries, mass killings have had a mobilizing effect and resulted in changes to laws and regulations.
item.dc:creator: DAN BILEFSKY and AUSTIN RAMZY

item.title: How Australia, Britain and Canada Have Responded to Gun Violence
item.description: In all three countries, mass killings have had a mobilizing effect and resulted in changes to laws and regulations.
item.dc:creator: DAN BILEFSKY and AUSTIN RAMZY

item.title: Mexico, Signaling Shift, Extradites Drug Kingpins to United States
item.description: Among the 13 people extradited are two top drug lords, including an American citizen, Edgar Valdez Villarreal, as well as others charged in the murders of U.S. government workers.
item.dc:creator: AZAM AHMED

item.title: David Cameron Grapples With Issue of Slavery Reparations in Jamaica
item.description: Jamaica’s prime minister, Portia Simpson Miller, raised the issue with Britain’s prime minister, Mr. Cameron, during a visit to the Caribbean island.
item.dc:creator: DAN BILEFSKY

item.title: World Briefing: Peru: Region in State of Emergency After Deadly Protests at a Mine
item.description: President Ollanta Humala of Peru declared a state of emergency in the southern Andes on Tuesday after three people died and scores were injured in protests of a Chinese-owned copper mining project.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: Obama and Raúl Castro Meet as U.S.-Cuba Ties Deepen
item.description: The meeting caps a period of remarkable change in the relationship between Cuba and the United States, beginning in April.
item.dc:creator: GARDINER HARRIS
item.media:description: President Raúl Castro of Cuba remarked on President Obama's height during a meeting on Tuesday at the United Nations.

item.title: At the U.N., Raúl Castro of Cuba Calls for End to U.S. Embargo
item.description: President Raúl Castro of Cuba called for an end to the economic embargo of his country on Monday at the United Nations General Assembly.
item.dc:creator: RUSSELL GOLDMAN
item.media:description: President Raúl Castro of Cuba prepared to address the United Nations General Assembly on Monday in New York.

item.title: Rallying Global Support, Obama Pledges Larger U.S. Role in Peacekeeping Missions
item.description: The president’s announcement followed a pledge from China that it would build an 8,000-member peacekeeping standby force and contribute $1 billion to a United Nations “peace and development fund.”
item.dc:creator: SOMINI SENGUPTA

item.title: President Obama’s Speech to the United Nations General Assembly 2015
item.description: The speech delivered by President Obama at the United Nations General Assembly as transcribed and released by the White House.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

item.title: Dilma Rousseff of Brazil Pledges to Reduce Greenhouse Gas Emissions
item.description: In her speech opening the General Assembly, Ms. Rousseff promised to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 2030, not merely slow their growth.
item.dc:creator: RUSSELL GOLDMAN

item.title: Obama Tackles Poverty and Sexism in U.N. Speech
item.description: Calling for better treatment of women around the world as he addressed the General Assembly, President Obama said he had no patience for excuses about discrimination.
item.dc:creator: GARDINER HARRIS

item.title: Francis in America: Pope Francis Addresses U.N., Calling for Peace and Environmental Justice
item.description: In his remarks, the pope placed blame for exploitation of natural resources on “a selfish and boundless thirst for power and material prosperity.”
item.dc:creator: SOMINI SENGUPTA and JIM YARDLEY
item.media:description: Pope Francis urged world leaders to care for the planet and the world’s poorest people. Later, the General Assembly adopted 17 goals, which extend through 2030.

item.title: Canada Revokes Citizenship of Bomb Plot Organizer
item.description: A controversial new law was used to strip the citizenship of Zakaria Amara, who is serving a life sentence for his role in a failed 2006 bombing plot in Toronto.
item.dc:creator: IAN AUSTEN

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg Announces Project to Connect Refugee Camps to the Internet
item.description: The connectivity ambitions are at the center of Mr. Zuckerberg’s advocacy effort, Internet.org, whose principal goal is to offer Internet access to about four billion people who cannot afford it.
item.dc:creator: SOMINI SENGUPTA
item.media:credit: Pool photo by Ted S. Warren
item.media:description: Mark Zuckerberg, right, head of Facebook, with President Xi Jinping of China on Wednesday.
